article_title: California Coastal Agency Takes on a Novel Role
article_text:
AVILA BEACH, Calif.—A state agency charged with conserving California's scenic coast is investing in a proposed shoreline development, part of a novel partnership that could serve as a national model.

The California State Coastal Conservancy, which ordinarily funds shoreline amenities such as walking trails through grants, has agreed to invest $400,000 toward the estimated $12 million to $14 million cost of a resort-campground...
